text:
In reply to <@UJBAJNFLK> "White text in a small font on a yellow background in fancy shapes is not my idea of an ergonomic interface" and <@UJ6LDMMN0> "I think one of the UX "regressions" from Scratch 2 with the new Scratch 3 design, is less readable block texts":

The rule you want to disable (or set to black) is `.blocklyText { fill: #fff }`. You might want to disable it for `.blocklyDropdownText` , too, but you'll get gray instead of black because the dropdown seems to be covered by a dim transparent overlay. Still, making the text black is a big improvement already.

Thanks a lot <@U01BSAKUDJQ> to point this out!

Since Konrad started to talk about it, it sticks in my mind and I can't wait to experiment different layouts...

Maybe, I will play with it on my local env. But before pushing it online, I guess I will try using it for some time. I have to be sure it looks OK.

I guess I also will make the blocks background lighters, if not completely white.

And, maybe, if I can, I will keep the two themes, for those that feel more comfortable with the original one.
